alert.note: Alert for Laurens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 11:49PM EST until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Enoree River basin in portions of Laurens, Spartanburg and Union SC Counties in Upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1145 PM EST, River gauges report ongoing minor flooding along the Enoree River, especially near Woodruff, South Carolina. High water conditions are possible along the Enoree River channel in sections adjacent to Laurens County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodruff, Enoree, Cross Anchor, Ora and Sedalia. - Expect flooding along the Enoree River to impact Beaverdam Church Road and Kilgore Bridge Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
